page.title: 03Large farms N.E.of Longmynd
page.content: The large farms surveyed had been owned by the same families for gen- erations.Nowadays they are run by very few men because of increased mechanis- ation.Harvesting of cereals and silage for winter feed is done by contractors The recent cut in milk quotas has forced a reduction in dairy herds and a switch to calf-rearing for beef.Gov- ernment grants are available for building improvements but are not sufficient to finance buildings of the required standard. Farmers are interested in conserv- ation and maintain hedges,woodland and paths.Sheep are reared on farms which own grazing land on the lower slopes of the Longmynd.Working collies are kept for livestock control.Some farmers'wives offer Bed & Breakfast to tourists and one farm has a popular small caravan site.
